meanings.definition: An ornamental set of objects, typically used for decoration.
meanings.sent1: The garniture of colorful flowers on the table brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: She carefully arranged the garniture of candles on the mantelpiece.
meanings.sent3: The garniture of ribbons on the gift made it look extra special.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a garniture of happiness that lit up the whole party.
meanings.sent5: The garniture of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A set of accessories or trimmings used to enhance the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: The chef added a garniture of fresh herbs to the dish before serving.
meanings.sent2: The garniture of jewels on her dress sparkled under the lights.
meanings.sent3: The garniture of bows on the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like a garniture of humor that entertained the audience.
meanings.sent5: The garniture of lace on the dress made it look exquisite.

meanings.definition: The act of garnishing or adorning something.
meanings.sent1: Her garniture of icing on the cake was beautifully done.
meanings.sent2: The artist's garniture of paint on the canvas created a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The garniture of confetti at the party added a festive touch.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a garniture of wisdom that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The garniture of flowers in the garden bloomed in vibrant colors.
